main module

class main.Query[source]

Bases: object

This class represents the Query type for the GraphQL schema and is in charge of handling all the fields defined in it, which in this case are the image processing algorithms.

async average_and_deviation(inpt: AverageInput) → AverageOutput

Function that executes the average and deviation algorithm on an image

Parameters:

inpt (AverageInput) – Input type for the average and deviation algorithm defined for the GraphQL scheme

Returns:

Output type defined when the response is two strings representing the mean and standard deviation for GraphQL schema

Return type:

AverageOutput

async binarization(inpt: BinarizationInput) → URL

Function that executes the binarization algorithm on an image

Parameters:

inpt (BinarizationInput) – Input type for the binarization algorithm defined for the GraphQL scheme

Returns:

Output type defined when the response is an url for GraphQL schema

Return type:

URL

async marching_squares(inpt: MarchingInput) → PolyData

Function that executes the marching squares algorithm on an image

Parameters:

inpt (MarchingInput) – Input type for the marching squares algorithm defined for the GraphQL scheme

Returns:

Output type defined when the response is a list of points and connections called polydata for GraphQL schema

Return type:

PolyData

main.get_server_info() → str[source]

This function determines and provides the IP address of the application’s local server.

Returns:

IP address of the application’s local server

Return type:

str

async main.main()[source]

This function is responsible for preparing and registering an instance of the application on a registration and discovery server called Spring Cloud Eureka. This allows other applications to dynamically find and communicate with this application through the Eureka server. Additional metadata, such as the microservice type, can help categorize and describe the application registered with the server.

async main.unregister_from_eureka()[source]

This function is responsible for performing unregistration and shutdown actions related to a Eureka client when the application is shutting down.
